Key Match Events: Australia avoided a third straight defeat to begin the World Cup.
Zampa picked up four wickets, his best bowling at a World Cup, and claimed the Player of the Match award.
Post-Match Reflections: Captain Pat Cummins was delighted with the performance and says his side were never going to let the pressure get to them.
Kusal Mendis highlighted too many 'risky shots' and not rotating the strike enough.
The five-time winners, Australia, will breathe a huge sigh of relief.

The early loss of Warner and Smith was a concern, but Australia kept their heads, steadied their nerves and lived to fight another day.
